First, I should probably think about relative speed. Since they're moving towards each other, their speeds should add up. So, 70 km/h plus 80 km/h is 150 km/h. That means together, they're closing the distance between them at 150 km per hour.

Now, the total distance between them is 500 km. So, if they're closing in at 150 km/h, the time it takes for them to meet should be the distance divided by their combined speed. So, time equals distance divided by speed, which is 500 km divided by 150 km/h.
